title: Reading Weather Signs from Smoke Behavior
brief: How to predict weather by observing the behavior of smoke from fires.
steps: Step 1: Light a small fire or observe existing smoke sources.
Step 2: Watch if smoke rises in a thin, vertical column - this indicates fair weather ahead.
Step 3: Observe if smoke rises low or flattens out - this indicates stormy weather approaching.
Step 4: Use this information to plan shelter and activity timing.
warnings: Smoke behavior can change quickly as weather fronts move in.
Don't rely solely on smoke - combine with other weather indicators.
